official-title.#text:
To require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to set reasonable limits on the
			 stringency and timing of proposed regulations for new residential wood
			 heaters, new residential hydronic heaters, new forced-air furnaces, and
			 new residential masonry heaters, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014

short-title.#text: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Regulation of new residential wood heaters, new residential hydronic heaters, new forced-air
			 furnaces, and new residential masonry heaters

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c

may not finalize, issue,
			 implement, or enforce any rule described in

unless such
			 rule meets the requirements described in

Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a
Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

quote.#tail:
published at 79 Fed. Reg. 6330 (February 3, 2014) or any successor or substantially similar rule;
			 and
quote.#text:
Standards of Performance for New Residential Wood Heaters, New Residential Hydronic Heaters and
			 Forced-Air Furnaces, and New Residential Masonry Heaters

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is applicable to any
			 new source that is a residential wood heater, a residential hydronic
			 heater, a forced-air furnace, or a residential masonry heater.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 111 of the Clean Air Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clean Air Act/s:111

text.#text: This Act applies during the 8-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in finalizing or issuing any rule described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c
Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not establish a particulate matter
			 emissions limit—

text.#text:
for adjustable rate wood heaters or pellet heaters/stoves that were, on or before the effective
			 date of the rule, certified as being in compliance with any applicable
			 standard of performance for particulate matter, that is less than 4.5
			 grams of particulate matter per hour;

quote.#tail: using either cordwood or cribs; or
quote.#text:
Standard Test Method for Measurement of Particulate Emissions and Heating Efficiency of Solid
			 Fuel-Fired Hydronic Heating Appliances

text.#text:
for any residential hydronic heater, that is less than 0.32 pound per million British thermal unit
			 heat output as measured under ASTM E2618–13

for any forced-air furnace, that is less than 0.93 pound per million British thermal unit heat
			 output.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in finalizing or issuing any rule described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c
Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as in compliance with any applicable emissions
			 limit in effect prior to the date of enactment of this Act—

text.#text:
with respect to a residential wood heater that was certified on or before the effective date of the
			 rule by the

provide that such certification shall remain valid until the date that is five years after such
			 heater was certified; and

permit any such heater to be manufactured and sold at retail until the date that is five years
			 after such heater was certified;
with respect to a forced-air furnace—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:2/sp:B/cl:ii

text.#text:
that is manufactured on or before the effective date of such rule, permit such forced-air furnace
			 to be sold at retail for a period of at least one year after such
			 effective date; or

that is manufactured after the effective date of such rule, not require such forced-air furnace to
			 meet any applicable particulate matter emissions limit set forth in such
			 rule until the date that is at least one year after such effective date;
			 or

that was tested under Canadian Standards Administration B415.1–10 test protocol on or before the
			 effective date of the rule and met a particulate matter emissions limit of
			 0.93 pound per million British thermal unit heat output, permit such
			 forced-air furnace to be manufactured and sold at retail for a period of
			 five years after such effective date; and
with respect to a hydronic heater that—

is a qualified model, deem such hydronic heater to be certified as in compliance with any otherwise
			 applicable emissions limit under such rule for the duration of the period
			 it would be considered a qualified model, but in no case for a period of
			 less than 3 years beginning on the effective date of such rule; or

is not a qualified model and that is manufactured on or before the effective date of such rule,
			 permit such hydronic heater to be sold at retail for a period of at least
			 one year after such effective date.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in finalizing or issuing any rule described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c
Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide that certifications of
			 compliance with any applicable emissions limit under such rule be issued
			 by independent third party laboratories accredited as certification bodies
			 under ISO/IEC 17065, based on testing performed by the certification body
			 or another laboratory accredited under ISO/IEC 17025 to perform
			 certification testing.

header.#text: Independent Accredited Third Party Testing and Certification

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in finalizing or issuing any rule described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c
Wood Stove Regulatory Relief Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
’s role in any certification or auditing process provided
			 in such rule shall be limited to conducting selective audits of the
			 testing, certification, and quality assurance/quality control functions
			 performed by certification bodies or test laboratories that are accredited
			 by the ISO.
